explosives.rationale: Because of a lack of data on the kick-off temperature and decomposition energy (though the substance contains nitro groups, with its oxygen budget calculated at -97). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#1598) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "flammable" by ICSC (2004). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#1598) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though the substance contains chemical groups associated with explosive properties that contain nitro groups. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#1598) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 340degC (ICSC, 2004).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 87.5degC (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 140degC)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 25mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 25mg/kg, 31mg/kg, 50mg/kg and 85mg/kg (EHC 220 (2000)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the LD50 (dermal route) value of 200mg/kg representing the lowest of the testing data, rat LD50 of 200mg/kg, 600mg/kg (EHC 220 (2000)) and rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 1,000mg/kg (EHC 220 (2000)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4-hour inhalation of dust/mist) value of 0.23mg/L (EHC 220 (2000).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (DFGOT vol.19 (2003)): "The substance causes moderate irritation."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (EHC 220 (2000)): "Corrosive."

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on positive data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests), described in EHC 220 (2000), ATSDR (1995) and NTP DB (Access on Apr., 2006).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Classification not possible given the insufficiency of data, along with the absence of existing classification.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence of resorption and malformation at doses causing parental toxicity, described in ATSDR (1995), EHC 220 (2000) and DFGOT vol.220 (2000).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (nervous system, liver) May cause damage to organs (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "coma, headache, nausea or vomiting" (RTECS (2004)), "pulmonary/brain edema" (HSDB (2003)), and the evidence from animal studies including "myospasm, tremor, ataxia, debility, hepatic swelling with hemorrhage and necrosis" (ATSDR (1995)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.classification: Category 1 (nervous system, respiratory system, liver, kidney), Category 2 (thymus, spleen)
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system, respiratory system, liver, kidney) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (thymus, spleen)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "headache, fever, hyperhidrosis, abnormal thirst, short of breath, coughing, vomiting, hyperpnoea, emotional anxiety, debility, yellow discoloration of skin/hair/sclera/conjunctiva, pulmonary edema, stupor and coma," "regressive degeneration occurs in the hepatic parenchyma and renal tubules," "neurotoxicity manifests as toxic psychosis and brain edema diagnosed based on occasional spasm; peripheral neuropathy, asthenia, fatigue and autonomic hypertonia have also been reported" (PATTY (4th, 1999)), and the evidence from animal studies including "increased BUN," "fatty degeneration of the liver," "atrophy or hyperplasia of the thymus and spleen" (ATSDR (1995)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (liver, kidneys) and Category 2 (thymus, spleen).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.066mg/L of the fish (Rainbow Trout) (EHC220, 2000).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=0.7(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 4%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
